fields.title: About
fields.content:
About ====

**OSU Bus** lets you see when the next busses will arrive at your favorite OSU CABS bus stop! It's a native iPhone client for the OSU TRIP website. Features ---------- * Save favorites on the main view for quick access. * Find the bus stop you want by listing them by route, or look at the whole list. * Check out the latest service bulletins in an animated banner at the top. * Find the stops nearest to you with the "Near Me" option. * Show the location of the current stop on the map. * Quicker load times (even over 3G) than the TRIP website, with a local cache of routes. See the [screenshots][] page for examples of what OSU Bus looks like, or [get it right now][appstore] from the App Store, for free! [screenshots]: screenshots [appstore]: http://itunes.apple.com/app/osu-bus/id410788785 I'm always looking for ways to improve OSU Bus. If you've found a bug you want fixed, or you have a neat idea for the next version, hop on over to the [suggestions][] page and tell me all about it, or send me an email at [griffith.637@osu.edu][email]. [suggestions]: suggestions [email]: mailto:griffith.637@osu.edu OSU Bus is open source software, and the source is released under the [GNU General Public License][gpl] (version 2). If you're feeling adventurous, you can browse the source at [GitHub][]. I always welcome patches! [gpl]: http://www.gnu.org/licenses/gpl-2.0.html [GitHub]: http://github.com/agrif/osubus/

fields.title: Donate
fields.content:
Donate ==== OSU Bus is free and open-source, under the [GNU GPL v2][gpl]. I'm a very strong believer in [free software][], and though free-from-cost is only a small part of that, I couldn't in good conscience release this as a for-pay app. However, there is some cost associated with the development of OSU Bus. This server hosts not just the website you are reading, but also updates to the local cache database that OSU Bus uses -- web hosting costs money. Just developing applications for the iPhone incurs a $100 annual fee to be part of Apple's developer program. [gpl]: http://www.gnu.org/licenses/gpl-2.0.html [free software]: http://www.gnu.org/philosophy/free-sw.html If you've used OSU Bus, and you like it, consider donating the few bucks you would have spent on it. It's a great morale booster for me, and donating is a great way to get my attention if there's a feature you want in the next version. You can donate either directly by clicking the button below, or you can read my spiel on [my website][donate]. [donate]: http://gamma-level.com/donate
Thank you.

fields.title: Suggestions
fields.content:
Suggestions
========

Right now, OSU Bus is a very simple application. It looks up bus arrival times; it does that fast and looks good doing it. But there are a lot of really cool things it could do, too. I've got a few things in mind... but I know I'll never think of all of them.

I want to know what you want OSU Bus to do. If it's a good idea, I'll be sure to include it in the next version! I can always be contacted at [griffith.637@osu.edu][email], or you can see [my site][contact] for a list of other ways to contact me.

 [email]: mailto:griffith.637@osu.edu
 [contact]: http://gamma-level.com/contact

Current Ideas
----------------
(*in no particular order*)

* built-in map with colored route lines
* individual bus tracking
* route planning
